line.content: Do you run a network?
Do you run servers?
Are you supposed to keep them “highly available”?
Do you know what their availability was yesterday?
Do you know which server had the lowest availability yesterday?
Did the latency on one of your WAN links increase yesterday?
Network Mom Availability is an easy-to-use tool for measuring and reporting availability and latency.
Know
what the availability of your network is.
Find
problems and fix them!
Increase
your network availability.
99.9% “three nines” availability is 86.4 seconds of downtime per device per day. This is easy with the discipline of measuring availability and fixing problems.
99.99% “four nines” availability is 8.64 seconds of downtime per device per day. This is hard but possible in a solid corporate network.
99.999% “five nines” availability is 25.92 seconds of downtime per device per
month
. If you ping test every 30 seconds, missing one ping means the device has failed for the month. This is only achievable in hardened corporate datacenters.
The first step to achieving high availability is to measure it. That is why
Network Mom Availability
is here.
